Reviews.Title: “visiting daughter”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hallway smelled of cigarette smoke, the bathroom had mold in the shower and on the ceiling, the air conditioner was falling apart, and there were stains on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here....horrible”
Reviews.Author: AZbaby
Reviews.Content: The hallway was creepy...check out was HORRIBLE....breakfast was fine for this type of hotel...beds were uncomfortable...rooms smelled horrible...do not recommend...and would never stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stop for a family”
Reviews.Author: routleyjulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family, nice jacuzzi, comfy beds, and free continental breakfast. Staff friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - typical 1 night stop over!”
Reviews.Author: Grumpyoldsoandso
Reviews.Content: First room we went into, walls were paper thin - could hear everything from people next door -who were very loud! This room was on the ground floor. We asked and immediately got another room in the corner on the top floor. Much quieter. Room ok - pretty standard and clean. Breakfast usual help yourself style - felt a bit alien to the other guests! Manager ( Asian lady and husband) nice and helpful. Wouldn't stay again unless you've arrived in the area late and want to just put your head down.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Timtaylorfan
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at night and it looked like there would be a drug dealer around every corner. The manager was nice, the room wasn't terrible, the a/c was whipping the curtains around, but the location was terrible. Wouldn't ever go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: coexistingmom
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place because we arrived after dark and left at dawn. WAs in a nice part of town, unlike the hotels near the airport which are near strip clubs, etc. Included continental breakfast was danish, cereal, bagels and cream cheese, and bananas. There was a Denny's, Waffle House and Cracker Barrel visible from the parking lot. Was pleasantly surprised by the mini-fridge. Room was clean and mostly comfortable. I will say that the bed wasn't as comfortable as others, but we paid so little that I thought it was an ok trade off. I've read some people complain about the furnishing not being stylish, but at this price, what do you expect? We spent most of time in the room with our eyes closed, so I wasn't looking at the furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “VERY QUITE”
Reviews.Author: anan01
Reviews.Content: When I am traveling I always stop by at this hotel whenever I have the option to do so. The prices of a single double and even a suite room is a very low price. It has free high speed internet access, free encore and all four HBO channels, free USA TODAY newspaper, a pool and Jacuzzi. The rooms are very clean and cozy with essentials needed such as hairdryer, coffee maker, microwave and a fridge. I felt safe around the area because it was very well lit and the parking lot was safe. They hafe well security everywhere, they have cameras and there is always someone at the desk. The location is great. You can never get bored because there is so much to do and see around this area. They have the Rock art museum nearby and the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport. Even the Anthem Outlet Mall is 5 miles down. Also, I took my friends to Castle and Coasters, which has rides and a golf area. There is also a HUGE water park and golf coarse nearby!!! A movie theater it close by as well. It is also surrounded by excellent restaurant. There is a lot of sit down places such as the Cracker-barrel, Thai Place and Marconi Grill and there is also fast food places which were walking distance likes taco bell, Mc Donald’s, Arby’s and In-n-Out. There is a variety of food places. If one would like to order food they have Pizza Huts number right on back of the key card, so that was efficient for us. The customer service is great. When I needed directions to the church, the front desk people were kind enough to help me find my destination. They are very kind and polite people who opened doors and helped with my baggage. I come here often! And you can even get a triple AAA discount!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: saltlakekid22
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I found it very convenient. It’s right off interstate 17 and it is easily accessible through the 101 loop. There’s also several restaurants and stores nearby. The rooms are quite immaculate as well. I would recommend this hotel to the average Joe.

Reviews.Title: “not high on my list!”
Reviews.Author: tootallandslick
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice here. First night was not good at all, room was dirty, bathroom was dirty, tub was moldy... Second night was in another room that was better but bathroom was still old and rusty looking. Breakfast choice not very good either. The only really good thing about this hotel is that it is close to the airport, which is why we chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: VanessaL
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great!! It is in a quiet area, right between a Dennys and a Waffle House. The area is safe and I never felt threatened. In addition, the hotel is very near a shopping area that has several great chain restaurants such as Macaroni Grill, Rubios and Chilis. The same shopping plaza has a Super Target and an AMC 30 theater. We stayed in a king suite which was very roomy for the money. The room did have a musty smell upon entering but running the A/C for about an hour did away with that completely. We were on the bottom floor and never heard any noise from the room above us. You can tell the property is not brand new but the bed was clean (no worn sheets) and the towels were in great shape. The front desk and house cleaning staff were very nice, going out of their way to help with our requests (extra towels, pillows, etc). This is not the Hilton and if you are expecting the Hilton in this area for less than a hundred dollars a night you are sadly mistaken. If you must have Hilton quality, for Heaven's sake, book the Hilton but don't book this and expect that kind of quality and fuss when you don't get it. For the money however, we were very happy and will return to this location should our travels take us to Phoenix again. Recommended for someone wanting a nice room (not a great room) for under $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: qwerttt
Reviews.Content: Black mold in bath. Terrible breakfast. Price was way too high (went during spring training).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. The rates were low during the time I went, the staff was pretty friendly, and the rooms were very nice and clean. The hotel is hooked up with wireless internet and it has like 4 HBO channels and encore. It’s also close to several restaurants, shopping places, and an AMC 30. Its also a couple miles away from a water park where my fiance and I had a blast. Definitely the place to stay when you’re in North Phoenix, it’s a sweet deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very basic”
Reviews.Author: Kaycj
Reviews.Content: This motel is pretty much located out in the middle of nowhere, but because it's close to the I-17, it's pretty easy to get to where you might want to go. Appears to be popular with long-distance truckers. The motel was very clean and quiet, but very, very basic. No frills. Bad pillows, altho the bed was pretty good. Thin towels, and yet, HBO was included. The unimpressive continental breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, cereal and doughnuts. But for the price, it's hard to complain.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 21636 North 26th Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85027
